page.title: 01Norton region
page.content: The Norton region lies to the west of the city of Stoke-on-Trent.Whilst Stoke is primarily an industrial area, famed for its pottery production, Norton and its surrounding villages has a more diverse nature.Firstly the area is made up of a number of separate villages, Ball Green,Brown Edge,Baddeley Green, and Norton itself, being the largest settlements. Most of these are old villages whose early economy was based on farming. But with the rise of Stoke-on-Trent as a large industrial centre its influence has been felt with the growth of industry such as the Doulton and Bullers ceramic works, and the now shrinking coal industry; and in the building of large housing estates to cater for the Stoke overflow. However the region still retains much of its character and independence.
